Native American in a term(of legal ,social and cultural significance) for indigenous peoples of the continental United States and Alaska(except The Inuit,Yupik,Aleut and related peoples) and the Metis (and other peoples of Amerindian and non-Amerindian ancestry).Amerindian is the correct term for all the indigenous peoples of North America and South America except the Inuit(and related peoples) and Metis (and other peoples of mixed Amerindian and non-Amerindian heritage)

Yes, they are an Indigenous Tribe of the so-called ‘Americas’. The term Native American, is usually used to describe the Indigenous Tribes of The United States, but now it is being used to describe all of the Indigenous Tribes of the Americas, North, Central and South.
